result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan M Wills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Total court costs due during the first 6 months of probation.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

AODA assessment and any follow-up counseling/treatment deemed appropriate.
Absolute sobriety.
No controlled substances/prescrip medic unless prescribed.  Agent to be notified before any prescriptions filled.
No contact with Walmart in Saukville WI.
Submit to DNA sample at Ozaukee County Jail by 1/9/16.

timeConds.notes: To be completed the first 6 months of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
